snippet: Your article was unnecessarily compromised by including the argument that teaching, the planned career of ''a large fraction of the female students'' at the University of California at Riverside, is ''a very modest ambition compared with pursuing ...
lead_paragraph: Your article was unnecessarily compromised by including the argument that teaching, the planned career of ''a large fraction of the female students'' at the University of California at Riverside, is ''a very modest ambition compared with pursuing a Ph.D. in cultural psychology'' (at Berkeley). It is just this kind of thinking that keeps the teaching profession undervalued, unrespected and underpaid. Robin Blum Berkeley, Calif.
abstract: Robin Blum letter says James Traub's May 2 article on affirmative-action policies in California undervalued the importance of pursuing a teaching career
